adventLectionary.title: Jesus comes to serve sacrificially
adventLectionary.html:
Mar 10:35-45

1035Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came over and spoke to him.

james the disciple & john the disciple

Teacher,

they said,

james the disciple & john the disciple

we want you to do us a favor.

jesus

36What is your request?

he asked.

37They replied,

james the disciple & john the disciple

When you sit on your glorious throne, we want to sit in places of honor next to you, one on your right and the other on your left.

38But Jesus said to them, 

jesus

You don’t know what you are asking! Are you able to drink from the bitter cup of suffering I am about to drink? Are you able to be baptized with the baptism of suffering I must be baptized with?

james the disciple & john the disciple

39Oh yes,

they replied,

james the disciple & john the disciple

we are able!

Then Jesus told them, 

jesus

You will indeed drink from my bitter cup and be baptized with my baptism of suffering. 40But I have no right to say who will sit on my right or my left. God has prepared those places for the ones he has chosen.

41When the ten other disciples heard what James and John had asked, they were indignant. 42So Jesus called them together and said, 

jesus

You know that the rulers in this world lord it over their people, and officials flaunt their authority over those under them. 43But among you it will be different. Whoever wants to be a leader among you must be your servant, 44and whoever wants to be first among you must be the slave of everyone else. 45For even the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve others and to give his life as a ransom for many.

Joh 10:11-18

jesus

1011“I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd sacrifices his life for the sheep. 12A hired hand will run when he sees a wolf coming. He will abandon the sheep because they don’t belong to him and he isn’t their shepherd. And so the wolf attacks them and scatters the flock. 13The hired hand runs away because he’s working only for the money and doesn’t really care about the sheep.
14“I am the good shepherd; I know my own sheep, and they know me, 15just as my Father knows me and I know the Father. So I sacrifice my life for the sheep. 16I have other sheep, too, that are not in this sheepfold. I must bring them also. They will listen to my voice, and there will be one flock with one shepherd.
17“The Father loves me because I sacrifice my life so I may take it back again. 18No one can take my life from me. I sacrifice it voluntarily. For I have the authority to lay it down when I want to and also to take it up again. For this is what my Father has commanded.”
adventLectionary.Question1: With which character do you most identify in this story ? Why?
adventLectionary.Question2: What strengths and/or weaknesses do you see in this character?
adventLectionary.Question3: What do you think God was wanting your selected character to learn?
adventLectionary.Question4: What do you think God is wanting you to learn through this story? How can you cooperate with his good purposes today?
